answers.answer: I would have her looked at.  If she was just clingy and a bit sleepy, I would think a virus of some sort, or even just tired.  But the sweet breathe combined with the other symptoms would have me having her checked out today.  Always best to be safe then sorry.
I ended up testing her blood sugar, and I noticed sh was very dehydrated. Her sugar was high, but not high enough to take her in. I am gonna keep an eye on her sugar levels for a while though

question: My one year old is very clingy and kind of sleepy today, and has sweet fruity breath. As an EMT, I would transport an adult or older child for possible dka, but I'm not sure what to do for a child this young. Diabetes does run in both parents family.
title: Daughters sweet fruity breath
